comment: The best way to learn engineering graphics is through hands-on practice and he does just that in class. There's a homework assignment every week, three quizzes that vary in difficulty, and the department-wide final. He does his best to prepare you for every assignment and really cares that you succeed. Definitely take him if you can!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I took Prof. Mishoe for engineering graphics and he was great. He was extremely nice and very interactive. Very receptive of questions and even challenging his opinion. Always graded very fairly and was always available for help and troubleshooting. It was an evening class and he kept us awake, down to earth funny guy.

He is a decent professor and very helpful during his lectures. I took him for ENGR graphiscs. He really shows compassion for his students, offering multiple extra credit opportunities including dropping the lowest assignment grade. I like the fact that he can humanize the material, making it easy comprehend. I learned a lot in his class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: Amazing professor! We moved at an accelerated pace but it was still manageable. He was super helpful and a great guy

He grades very fairly and cares about how well you do. I took him during his first semester teaching and he didn't know we were learning things that the next engineering graphics class used as it's final exam. All of us understood what he was teaching. Also, he's really funny. I would highly recommend him.
It is his first semester teaching and he is pretty cool. If you never have done drawings or any CAD programs; GO TO CLASS. He will always help you out.
